intro: Epidendrum magnibracteum, commonly known as the giant bract epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences that can reach several feet in length, featuring numerous fragrant, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, warm environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Epidendrum magnibracteum is valued in horticulture for its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
